de.fu.junction.converter
Class GenericConverter<T>

java.lang.Object
  de.fu.junction.converter.GenericConverter<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
StringConverter<T>
public class GenericConverter<T>
extends Object
implements StringConverter<T>

A GenericConverter converts a String to anything which has its own means for parsing a value from a String There is also a version of this class without the need for a Type-parameter which returns a value which has the static type Object.

Since:
Iteration4

          Creates a new GenericConverter

Constructor Detail

GenericConverter

public GenericConverter(Class<T> type)
Creates a new GenericConverter

The type to convert to needs to have a Converter having one parameter (and one parameter only) of the type string. Example types for which a generic conversion (since their constructor do it) can be done are Integer, BigDecimal or Double.

Parameters:
type - The type to convert to.
Throws:
RuntimeException - If the type does not feature a constructor with one parameter of the type String.
Method Detail

convert

public T convert(String value)
Description copied from interface: StringConverter
Converts the given value to the corresponding type T.

Specified by:
convert in interface StringConverter<T>
Parameters:
value - The string which is to be converted
Returns:
The converted value or null if the string-value can not be converted
